conclusion: Need to analyze the v-t graph to determine if the particle undergoes linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time and is represented by the slope of the tangent to the curve on a v-t graph.
The steeper the slope on the v-t graph, the higher the acceleration.
The red lines in the illustration are tangent lines at different points between 1 and 2 seconds.
The slope of the tangent lines represents the acceleration at those points.
From 1 to 2 seconds, if the slopes of the tangent lines are getting less steep, it indicates that the acceleration is decreasing.
In the image, the tangent lines appear to flatten as time progresses from 1 to 2 seconds.
Since the slopes of the tangent lines are decreasing, the particle's acceleration is gradually decreasing during this interval.
Yes, it is correct to say that the particle undergoes linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
